The freight train aint just gonna run over theze guyz, when hit they are gonna EXPLODE against the grill with blood and guts flying everywhere.... Its gonna be messy, folks.... Whats funny iz that if theze idiots were just a bit further down the trax, maybe a few feet maybe a mile or two, they could enjoy delectible nibblez along the trax without worry, for a HUGE subsidance under a section of failed trax liez between those deer that hang with dear ol sybil and that runnaway frieght train thats loaded with koolaid drinking party baggiez. When that freight train hits that chasm its gonna derail in a BIG fvck in BOOM az the fuel tankerz, hazmats , and koolaid drinkerz blow up in a giagantic plume of fire, noxious fumez , and twisted metal...... BAAABOOOOM, biaotchez. Sybz and a few other keen deer will look up when the train derailz amd explodez for but a breif moment and then resume nibbling on delicious berriez. Crack head option buyerz will be lined up naked along an open mass grave on thursday promptly at 4:00pm est and gunned down buy robots armed with 50 cal machine gunz . Bot ownerz request that crackheadz please place their wallets in the large baskets to the right, and line up along the dirch one in front of another to save expensive 50 cal ammo... Topic.Title: Action: Sell Short

Message.Msg: Keep in mind that by "good quarter" of course I mean relative to expectations. Really this is more of a farce of course. Ex items they made a plug NICKEL and NEGATIVE FREE CASH FLOW of $42M Pro Bull Case would be dependent on: - They show they can consistently increase subs well above the 30M level. - They show that they have pricing power by increasing subs costs several dollars without losing an offsetting number of subs. - They can decrease content costs going forward. - Making money doesn't matter. Stocks can run up for years hiding losses, taking more debt on off balance sheet, etc. I'm somewhat being sarcastic here but not totally. If supported by the right crooks, anything's possible. Pro Bear Case: - Valuation, priced for perfection assuming everything goes according to plan and then some. - Most pay cable channels have had trouble getting beyond the 30M domestic subs level. CEO Hastings long term plan has the most conservative long term number at something like 54M subs. Although Netflix has a cheaper monthly cost to the consumer than HBO, this seems like a stretch. - Content costs will increase and not decrease. - Whitney Tilson says $400/sub is cheap when cell phone companies are more like $1000/sub. This is an idiotic statement since a sub can't be valued the same way obviously from industry to industry. A cheap cell phone plan is close to $50/mo vs $8/mo for Netflix. The average cell phone bill is undoubtedly higher Just using back of the envelope math here, a Netflix sub would be worth $160, no where near $400. - Netflix best money maker is the DVD business which is a negative growth area with lots of competition. - More and more companies joining the same space so pricing power will be limited at best. - TIMBER action will most likely happen at some point soon. In an ironic twist House of Cards is what be what they are talking about after this latest collapse, tying the show to this real life house of cards.

Cheerleading for what are unquestionably trading scams (like Tepper, there are a lot of people who have to get out of these scams while the getting is good...). Topic.Title: Almost there...

Message.Msg: I knew that it was going to get crazy in the last throws. This is the desperation of a system nearing catastrophic failure... The bond squeeze has been underway. It will fail. People like my parents are happy to see capital returned and hold TBills. It looks to me at this point that it be gold that leads to the systemic crisis because the FED and TBTF/SIFI/BB continue to try to break it down when trust in those institutions is GONE.The games taking place right now demonstrate why no one trusts the financial sector anymore, making gold an essential asset in the portfolio. Physical demand is not abating and will not abate. We've already seen technical defaults in gold (settlement with paper rather than bullion). It will get worse... There will either by significant defaults on contracts, or there will be a reversal and parabolic ascent. Just wait here. The real economy is not strong. Amazon will see its gift card redemptions accelerate and its average order size/shipment decrease, especially amongst "Discount/Value Prime" (the new cohort which is joining Prime based upon multiple stacked loss leader versus "High Value / High Purchasing Power Prime" which joined because they would save money on large volumes of purchases). The profitability will drop even more, especially if/as gas prices remain elevated from geopolitical risks. The entirety of this scam will see light of day...

Topic.Title: AMZN stock drop will be sharp and educational

Message.Msg: We're already at $245 a couple of weeks ago. This thing will either be propped up a while longer or will go the route of Apple or worse. Since it's too big, there is no place to unload anywhere so I'll go with the propping option as long as the market keep reaching new highs. it will be okay as long as the insiders doesn't sale en masse. Since hitting almost $250 in 2011, it has gone practically no where in the next two years while the market is at an all time high. It's a sign that institutions are holding a dog but can't liquidate without serious losses so the extend and pretend will have to go a while longer when the revenue is still growing 20%+ . My guess is when growth drop to the teens, they will run for the exits even faster than Apple especially with no earnings to show for. We maybe a quarter or two away from this scenario if the current economic conditions show no signs of improving or getting worse. Bezos can build all the warehouses he want, it will not matter.

Topic.Title: AMZN stock drop will be sharp and educational

Message.Msg: Follow the changes in cash balance over the past few years by quarter. Check out the growth in days payable. Between increase in days payable and increase in gift cards, Amazon's has inflated its cash by about $2.7B. Should the economy materially weaken (especially if we did have a shock), the unwind of that $2,7B would be rather difficult right now (pushing current ratio below 1...). If all the gift cards / accrued liabilities were to be redeemed, Amazon would need to have a distressed offering... And all this despite raising $3B in LT debt in Q4 (which puts debt to book equity at industry norms). This scam is running out of cash to perpetuate itself... No cash for buybacks makes the frontrunning float jam games harder....
